name: Third Party Due Diligence Questionnaire
Introduction
description:
Grünenthal considers Due Diligence as a key element to managing compliance, ethical and reputational risks associated with third parties. As a potential business partner for Grünenthal. we kindly request you to provide us with all the information required below. The data you may provide through this questionnaire will only be used for evaluating the risks that this relationship may expose Grünenthal to and conducting our standard operating and accounting processes. 



﻿Please provide the information in digital format.

name: Company and Country Details
Additional Background Information

description: Please provide the following financial information from the last three financial years.

choices.EU, US or other applicable local sanctio: EU, US or other applicable local sanction list

name: Will your company or any of your subsidiaries or subcontractors come into contact with government or public officials in the course of doing work for our organization?

To the best of your knowledge, is your company, any of its shareholders (including ultimate beneficiary owners), or any subsidiaries or subcontractors involved in this business relationship, listed in any EU, US or other applicable local sanction or denied party list, or subject to an embargo?

To the best of your knowledge, is there any situation that is or may be perceived to be a conflict of interest involving your company, the ultimate beneficiary owners, board members, its directors or any subsidiaries or subcontractors used and Grünenthal or any of its employees?
helpText:
The term "conflict of interest" refers to a situation where:

- Private and business interests interfere

- Professional decision making can be influenced by private interests, also from relatives or friends

- A professional decision might be affected by a relationship to a company or an individual

name: To the best of your knowledge, has your company, subsidiaries or subcontractors to be used in relation to this service, or any of its directors, board members and / or ultimate beneficiary owners, ever been investigated, prosecuted or convicted for a criminal offense by a law enforcement authority or any central / regional / local government authority, or ever been fined or sanctioned in relation to human rights or environmental related breaches?

Is your company aware of and agrees to abide by the provisions of all applicable laws, including matters such as (but not limited to) anti-corruption, anti-money-laundering, data protection laws and human rights and environment protection, and is in possession of all valid business registrations, authorizations, permits and licenses in order to perform work for our organization?
Is your company in possession of all valid business registrations, tax registrations, authorizations, permits, licenses, etc. in all countries where the services will be provided to Grünenthal?

Does your company follow a corporate or industry code of conduct / code of practice which covers common Compliance topics such as integrity, health & safety, confidentiality, anti-corruption, conflicts of interest, fair competition, data protection, environment protection, human rights, etc?

To the best of your knowledge, is the subcontractor directly or indirectly owned, managed by or related to government or public officials or any kind of public authority, or will it come into contact with government or public officials in the course of doing work for our organization?

To the best of your knowledge, is the subcontractor, any of its shareholders (including ultimate beneficiary owners), or any subsidiaries or subcontractors involved in this business relationship, listed in any EU, US or other applicable local sanction or denied party list, or subject to an embargo?

To the best of your knowledge, is there any situation that is or may be perceived to be a conflict of interest involving the subcontractor, the ultimate beneficiary owners, board members or its directors and Grünenthal or any of its employees?
Does your company have a policy on whistleblowing which enables the reporting (internally and externally) of suspected violations?
Is your company supported by a Legal department?
Is your company supported by a Compliance department?
Please elaborate on your answer above.

Please select the preferred Language
Please describe briefly the reasons for not abiding by the above mentioned laws.
Has your company established a dedicated risk management system to deal with human rights and environmental related risks?

Does your organization have a policy statement regarding environmental and human rights that goes beyond a standard code of conduct (e.g. on topics such as the prohibition of child labor, forced labor or slavery, freedom of association, non-discrimination, non-harassment, wages and benefits, standard working hours & overtime, anti-human trafficking, accident/medical emergency at work, occupational health & safety standards, handling and disposal of waste, handling of persistent organic pollutants, handling of mercury, etc)?

Does your human rights and environmental risk management system include a process to ensure the enforcement of due diligence obligations for indirect vendor, the implementation of preventive measures, a process for taking and documenting remedial actions, and the reporting of all these efforts?
Has your organization designated a responsible officer that is in charge of human and environmental rights within your company?

To the best of your knowledge, are you aware of any red flags, human rights, environmental or health and safety related risks in your business or in your supply chain (including any indirect vendor whose supplies are necessary to manufacture the product or for the provision and use of the relevant service)?
helpText:
The term "human rights" refers to standards that recognize and protect the dignity of all human beings. Human rights govern how individual human beings live in society and with each other (within the business context covering ethics, labour, health and safety). These include, amongst others, the prohibition of child labour, protection against slavery and forced labour, freedom from discrimination, protection against unlawful land confiscation, occupational safety and health and related health hazards, the prohibition of withholding an adequate wage, the right to form trade unions or workers’ representative bodies, the prohibition of causing harmful soil or water contamination and protection against torture.​

​

The term "environmental risks" refers to a situation where any waste, wastewater or emissions adversely impact human or environmental health or which contributes to climate change, uses harmful substances or wastes precious resource.)
